column4: Does anyone have a guide, or even better experience in sharing a printer with cups without any gui tools
google?
pathetic
from command line in other words, right?
yes, there was a thread on the ubuntu forums but that appears to have been archived
did you know that cups has a web based interface?
I am aware of it, but I'm not sure I'll be able to configure it due to the network configuration I'm running at the moment
I think I may have found the thread.
http://localhost:631
I'm not on the local host - as I said I don't think it will work on my network setup
if cups is runing, then the web based interface should be as well, since it's usually built in.
anyways, the google results are in: http://www.novell.com/documentation/suse91/suselinux-adminguide/html/ch05s07.html
- I'll say it again, due to the network configuration I don't think that will work at this moment in time. I'll have to go about reconfiguring the network/server to allow that
suse linux works differently for the setup.
yes, but you don't know if it will work until you've tried, right?
not /that/ different
tell you what, please don't comment on this topic any more. Thanks for you time. I've said 3 times it won't work
it's worked for me for ubuntu, slackware, debian, freespire, knoppix, slax, redhat, suse, gentoo...
don't say it doesn't work till you've at least tried it and have the error message.
please drop it, I know it doesn't work
The concepts are the same, from distro to distro.  The only differences is most likely where the files are stored, and a simple locate/slocate/find can help you out there.
one final time. Please stop discussing this topic with me. While I appriciate your help/input, your not listening to me that dues to my configuration I can't use the tools your suggesting
You can't even use the tools that come with the cups packages?
not the web based tools. I have a how to that will allow me to configure cups from the command line, and I'm working through that
